title: Hyundai partners with research institutes to develop vehicle for lunar surface exploration
summary: The Korean carmaker and its sister company Kia Motors formed a consortium July 27 with six state-funded research institutes here to explore the concept of lunar exploration mobility and core technologies required.

title: NASA revises requirements for ISS private astronaut missions
summary: NASA is changing rules for future private astronaut missions to the International Space Station, including requiring such missions to be led by a former NASA astronaut.

title: Rocket Lab’s Electron to launch NROL-199 mission
summary: Rocket Lab is scheduled to launch the 29th Electron mission on August 2 at 05:00 UTC. NROL-199 will launch from Launch Complex-1B (LC-1B) at Rocket Lab’s launch facility on the Māhia Peninsula in New Zealand.

title: NASA Television Transponder Change Monday, Aug. 29
summary: NASA Television programming on the Galaxy 13 domestic satellite is moving from transponder 11 to transponder 15 this month.

title: December launch planned for Polaris Dawn
summary: The privately funded Polaris Program is planning its first crewed launch on a SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft in December, a mission that will include the first spacewalk on a private mission.

title: SES closes $450 million acquisition of DRS’ satellite communications business
summary: SES announced Aug. 1 it completed the acquisition of DRS Global Enterprise Solutions, a business acquired from Leonardo DRS for $450 million.

title: SLS Stages in assembly at MAF for future NASA Artemis launches
summary: Boeing, the prime Stages contractor for NASA’s Space Launch System (SLS) program, is working on the production and development of hardware for the third and fourth Artemis launches at the Michoud Assembly Facility (MAF) in New Orleans. Welded and bolted structures for the third and fourth Core Stage vehicles are being assembled in parallel with preparations to begin the initial production of the new Exploration Upper Stage (EUS).

title: Isotropic Systems rebrands as All.Space and unveils latest terminal
summary: Isotropic Systems is changing its name to All.Space as the British antenna manufacturer unveil its “fifth-generation smart terminal” to link cellular and satellite networks.

title: We’re about to enter the heart of the Atlantic hurricane season
summary: About 90 percent of the Atlantic's tropical activity comes after August 1.

title: Space Force to take on bigger role planning future DoD space investments
summary: As “integrator for joint space requirements" the Space Force will have to coordinate the wish lists of the Army, Navy, Marine Corps and Air Force, and recommend how to meet future needs
